array.string: Gotta admit, I’ve never really been the journaling type. Having always been busy, every attempt was quickly shot down after an entry or two.
But this time, it’s different. When I found this journal while scavenging for food, I felt immediately drawn to it.
Why? I really don’t know.
Maybe it’s because I’ve been alone for.. how long now? A year? And I’m feeling a little lonely. It’s something to talk to.
Or maybe it’s because I’m feeling the need to document my experiences... To leave a mark on this desolate planet before I’m extinguished in the never-ending rain of rubble.
Huh, that sounded a lot more depressing than I intended.
Well if that’s the case, then I guess I’ll have to explain what happened, and rewind the past four years to the very beginning.
It all started with the grand ol’ election of the new president of the United States.
Through President Lawson, our country entered an era of large scale disputes and repression that shook the country.
On March 15, 2011, the US government captured and tortured a group of school children, aged 10-15, for spray-painting anti-government slogans on school property in Flint, MI.

When people began protesting the government’s actions in Detroit and Atlanta, violence erupted. The military stepped up its action against the nation’s own citizens, killing and injuring many people in the process.
Many military personnel who disagreed with their own government’s actions took an oath to protect the citizens demonstrations, and called themselves The Liberty Corps, or TLC.
The government considered this treason, and the War of Democracy commenced.
Using this opportunity of instability, an old extremist group had a resurgence.
In 2006, Rev. Ronald Atwood founded Lord’s Opposition of the United States, or LOTUS.
Back then, they had a very small following, but that was only in the beginning.
In this chaos, LOTUS sought national redemption through their twisted worldview.
What began as an extremist sect in Chattanooga, TN, quickly spread through the Bible Belt and became a violent proponent of radical Christianity.
To add to the confusion, a faction within Texas, the Alamo Defense, declared independence, adopting a neutral stance with everyone except for LOTUS.
As of today, the current state of the nation looks like this:
It’s complicated, I know, but that’s what we’re all living with now.
Well, I guess it’s not really ‘we’ anymore.
My family and I had always lived downtown in Greenville, South Carolina for as long as I can remember, and when the civil war broke out we all agreed to stay put.
I mean, nothing bad ever happened around here anyways.
Last time we checked, LOTUS was still around Atlanta and the US Government was fighting the Liberty Corps way up in the north.

But as days went by and the sounds of bombs came closer, panic and tension began to rise within our city. Almost a fourth of our city evacuated north towards Canada, leaving around 350,000 of us unsure of what to do.
My family decided to temporarily move in with family members in Spartanburg, SC, with plans for me to join several days later.
But the day I was supposed to leave, there was an explosion. And a lockdown. Just on Western Greenville. The Liberty Corps was here, and I was stuck.
“Nobody is allowed in or out and no outgoing communication is allowed.”
That was about a year ago, and I haven’t spoken to my family since.
When the Liberty Corps said nobody was allowed in or out, that unfortunately also meant the food within our city was all we had to survive.
We citizens tried fighting back. We didn’t want to be used as human shields against the US Government.
But our attempts were futile against their military-grade weapons, and we were quickly forced to learn the ‘new way’ of life.
So I’ve been lucky. Really lucky, actually, to have survived this long.
Everything here is rationed, and everyone, no matter what size, gets only 200-300g of rice without any salt or oil.
When it’s not enough, I have to go out and scavenge for extra food, water, medicine, you name it, in the hopes that I won’t die from a stray gunshot or a shelling.
Sometimes the supplies I find will last me and those around me for a while, but tomorrow it’s time for me to go out again and find more food.
Where should I go? X-Mart or Underground Cafe?

X-mart has a higher chance of having food, but it’s also been ransacked multiple times in the past year. Will there still be any food left? I’ve also heard that it can get bloody, considering everyone here is armed...
Underground Cafe would definitely be a much safer decision, but would I even find anything? I mean, it’s a coffeehouse for goodness sake. I don’t want to waste energy going there to find nothing.
Y’know what? I think I’ve made my decision. Tomorrow I’m going to: A) X-Mart. B) Underground Cafe.
Well, I guess I have to go pack and get to bed then. Crossing my fingers that everything works out tomorrow.
Wow, was I actually able to sleep last night? It’s really been awhile since I’ve slept uninterrupted like that.
Usually you hear the deafening roars of planes above that just.. won’t.. stop.
Heh, who knows. Maybe it’s because I started writing in this journal or something. Things are already looking up a bit.
Since last night I decided to travel to X-Mart, I’m probably going to head out soon once I get all my stuff together.
Breakfast will have to wait until the next batch of food is securely brought back into this apartment room. Geez, I really can’t afford coming back empty-handed then can I?
Alright, so here’s the thing. Last night before I fell asleep, I realized that writing in this journal while scavenging would be impossible. Illogical. Suicidal.
So genius me came up with a plan, and I think it might actually work! The other day I was scavenging through an empty law firm, and I found this tiny portable voice recorder.
It runs on two AA batteries, which can be re-charged with the solar powered chargers the UN gave us several months back.

If I turn the recorder on and off based on when I’m actually doing something or not, hey, I could just talk into it instead! It’s even got a long neck strap that I could use so I’ll have both hands available when needed.
And once I get back from the trip, I’ll just listen to the recording and write everything that happened back into this journal. It would work, right?
Yeah, it would be time-consuming and extra effort, I know, but at the same time I think it would be interesting. I’m just going to try it out today and see how it goes.
If it doesn’t work out, I’m sure there is another solution.
So, now that I’ve changed and grabbed my backpack, I think it’s time for me to go. I think I’ll keep the voice recorder off until I get to X-Mart, so I’ll talk again in a bit.
Praying that this isn’t the last time I’ll see this cold, yet comforting room.
Annnd I made it! The city was eerily quiet this morning with only a few people walking around, but I was fortunate enough to get here pretty easily.

Now the scary part is walking in. The only weapon I have so far is a machete, which sucks cause some people around here are armed with guns. Everyone usually works together to help each other out, but some out there..
Shoot, alright I gotta stop talking for a second to focus. I think I sensed some movement in the back, but I highly doubt it’s a human. A raccoon maybe? Hopefully?
So now I’m walking in and just quickly scanning around.. Let’s see.. Yeah, everything is pretty much taken and the place is all torn up from the shellings.
Not to mention that awful stench..
Maybe coming here wasn’t the best idea after all. I mean, what did I expect thou..
Oh hey! What’s that in the back? I think I see some food!

Okay, so it looks like we’ve found a small stack of moldy… bread? I think? I don’t really know what it exactly is, but it looks edible! Oh and a big jar of unopened tomato paste.. Wow I think we hit the jackpot today!

Alright, so here’s what I could do. I could either just take the tomato paste and call it a day for now (even though it’s not much), or I could take the tomato paste and also eat the “bread” on the way back for breakfast!
Just thinking about it sounds amazing.. Man, I’m starving.
You know what? I think I’ll.. A) take the bread and tomato paste. B) only take the tomato paste.
I mean seriously, I’m starving. A little staleness won’t bother me. I should treat myself with the best I can get.

Alright so I think I’m going to head back now. Already took a bite of the “bread” and.. Okay not going to lie, it tastes horrible. But it’s extra calories that’s going to keep me alive, so I’m going to stop complaining.
Turning off the recorder, I’ll turn it on again when I’m safely back in my room.
Made it back! It’s always relieving to be back here.
It’s not necessarily safe, but traces of old memories can be found which bring back feelings of nostalgia when I’m feeling hopeless.
Kinda need that comfort right now actually. That piece of “bread” I ate earlier? I think it had some weird bacteria or something in it..
I really don’t feel too good.
Maybe a quick nap will help? Once I feel better I’ll start writing directly in the journal again.
Did I say that the nap would help? I lied. I feel way worse.
I’ve thrown up four different times now, and I still feel like throwing up even though I have nothing in my stomach anymore. I can already feel my body becoming weaker, which is a really bad sign.
I’ve survived this long, I’m not letting a piece of moldy bread kill me.

Maybe some Ibuprofen that I have stored will relieve some of the pain, and I’ll be able to sleep it all off. Looks like I’ll be writing all of these recordings back into my journal tomorrow. Can’t really find the energy to right now..
Here’s an early goodnight.
Better to be safe than sorry. I’ve survived this long, and I’m not letting a piece of moldy bread kill me.
And hey, tomato paste is a luxury around here. Going days without food is usually the norm, and I’ll most likely have to ration this jar too.

Anyways, even though we have plenty of time to scavenge other places, I think it would be a smarter idea to head back for now. I have a really bad feeling about this area since it’s extremely close to the edge of the city.
To prevent people from escaping, TLC usually has the borders rigged with landmines and have snipers watching 24/7. A friend of mine tried last month but.. Yeah, let’s not talk about him.
Turning off the recorder, but I’ll turn it on again when I’m safely back in my room.
Made it back! It’s always relieving to be back here.
It’s not necessarily safe, but traces of old memories can be found which bring back feelings of nostalgia when I’m feeling hopeless.
Kinda need that comfort right now actually. I forgot to mention this, but our city gets bombed around six times a day on average, whether it be barrel bombs or bunker busters.

I’ve been unbelievably lucky, with only a part of our house crushed. But today the bombs are closer, a LOT closer than usual. I should probably sleep in my makeshift bunker (the basement) for tonight, just in case.
So now what do I do? Other than retrieving my 200g scoop of rice, all I can think about doing now is reading.
It’s a hobby I’ve picked up in the past several months. It replaces all of the time I used to spend on the internet.
I miss the internet. I miss going on YouTube to watch Buzzfeed videos or scrolling through Instagram to like pictures of exotic travel destinations around the world.

I’ve heard that some people were able to get internet around here recently, but I haven’t been able to figure out where to go to get it. My phone is all charged up with the solar-chargers but it’s pretty much useless without service.
Anyways, books help me escape all of that. Which world should I step in today? Non-fiction or fiction?
Probably fiction. “Seveneves”, to be exact. Always liked a little Sci-Fi.
Well, I guess that’s all I need to record for today. Hopefully my bunker holds up tonight - it would be a shame if this diary ended only after two days.
Haha. Knock on wood.
Well, I guess I have to go pack and get to bed then. Crossing my fingers that everything works out tomorrow.
Wow, was I actually able to sleep last night? It’s really been awhile since I’ve slept uninterrupted like that.
Usually you hear the deafening roars of planes above that just.. won’t.. stop.
Heh, who knows. Maybe it’s because I started writing in this journal or something. Things are already starting to look up a bit.
Since last night I decided to travel to Underground Cafe, I’m probably going to head out soon once I get all my stuff together.
Breakfast will have to wait until the next batch of food is securely brought back into this apartment room. Geez, I really can’t afford coming back empty-handed then can I?
Alright, so here’s the thing. Last night before I fell asleep, I realized that writing in this journal while scavenging would be impossible. Illogical. Suicidal.
So genius me came up with a plan, and I think it might actually work! The other day I was scavenging through an empty law firm, and I found this tiny portable voice recorder.
It runs on two AA batteries, which can be re-charged with the solar powered chargers the UN gave us several months back.
If I turn the recorder on and off based on when I’m actually doing something or not, hey, I could just talk into it instead!
And once I get back from the trip, I’ll just listen to the recording and write everything that happened back into this journal. It would work, right?
Yeah, it would be time-consuming and extra effort, I know, but at the same time I think it would be interesting. I’m just going to try it out today and see how it goes.
If it doesn’t work out, I’m sure there is another solution.
So, now that I’ve changed and grabbed my backpack, I think it’s time for me to go. I think I’ll keep the voice recorder off until I get to Underground Cafe, so I’ll talk again in a bit.
Praying that this isn’t the last time I’ll see this cold, yet comforting room.
Annnd I made it! The city was eerily quiet this morning with only a few people walking around, but I was fortunate enough to get here pretty easily.

Now, the scary part is walking in. The only weapon I have so far is a machete, which sucks cause some people around here are armed with guns. Everyone usually works together to help each other out, but some out there..
Looks like the entrance is pretty busted too. Let’s see if I can discreetly step in through the smashed windows instead of attempting to open the deformed door.
Lemme just get all Cirque Du Soleil over here.. Ugh… And.. I’m... in! Yes!
Hopefully getting out won’t be as hard since no… Shit, what was that noise?
I swear I just heard some noises coming from the back. I guess it would be no surprise that people are staying in here for shelter, since it’s underground.
Which could mean.. They could get a little angry if they knew I was here looking for food right? If they claimed this place as theirs?
I should make this trip as quick as possible. In and out, just like that.
So now I’m just quickly scanning around.. Let’s see.. Yeah, everything is pretty much taken and the place is crumbling from the shellings.
Not to mention that awful stench..
Maybe coming here wasn’t the best idea after all. I mean, what did I expect though...
Oh hey! What’s that on the counter? I think I see a drink!
Okay, so it looks like we have a can of rip-off Sprite? I think? Man I haven’t had soda in so long.. Looks like we hit the jackpot today!

Alright, so here’s what I could do. I could either just leave with this can of soda and call it a day for now, or check out the back kitchen and maybe find actual food to eat. It would be a reasonable risk to take..
I think I’m going to.. A) leave with the can of soda. B) explore the back kitchen for more.
Better to be safe than sorry. I’ve survived this long, so I’m not going to push my luck any further.
And hey, any form of drink is a luxury around here. Going days without clean water is usually the norm, and I’ll most definitely have to ration this can.

Anyways, even though we have plenty of time to scavenge other places, I think it would be a smarter idea to head back for now. I have a really bad feeling about this area since it’s in the dead center of the city.
The US Government usually likes to drop barrel bombs around here, since they think all TLC members are hiding within us, the innocent citizens.
Turning off the recorder, but I’ll turn it on again when I’m safely back in my room.
Made it back! It’s always relieving to be back here.
It’s not necessarily safe, but traces of old memories can be found which bring back feelings of nostalgia when I’m feeling hopeless.
Kinda need that comfort right now actually. I forgot to mention this, but our city gets bombed around six times a day on average, whether it be barrel bombs or bunker busters.

I’ve been unbelievably lucky, with only a part of our house crushed. But today the bombs are closer, a LOT closer than usual. I should probably sleep in my makeshift bunker (the basement) for tonight, just in case.
So now what do I do? Other than retrieving my 200g scoop of rice, all I can think about doing now is reading.
It’s a hobby I’ve picked up in the past several months. It replaces all of the time I used to spend on the internet.
I miss the internet. I miss going on YouTube to watch Buzzfeed videos or scrolling through Instagram to like pictures of exotic travel destinations around the world.

I’ve heard that some people were able to get internet around here recently, but I haven’t been able to figure out where to go to get it. My phone is all charged up with the solar-chargers but it’s pretty much useless without service.
Anyways, books help me escape all of that. Which world should I step in today? Non-fiction or fiction?
Probably fiction. “Seveneves”, to be exact. Always liked a little Sci-Fi.
Well, I guess that’s all I need to record for today. Hopefully my bunker holds up tonight; it would be a shame if this diary ended only after two days.
Haha. Knock on wood.
I mean seriously, I’m starving. A little curiosity won’t hurt. And honestly, what do I have to lose?
Just have to be super cautious… and quiet…
I’m pretty sure the kitchen is on the left once I walk into the room with the red curtains. I’ve been here a couple of times, years ago, and that’s what my faint memories are telling me.
Let me just quietly… tip… toe…
OH SHIT WAIT NO STO-
*Gunshots*
Now that, was a scary night.
The bombs were close, way too close for me to even close my eyes.

The ground constantly jolting you awake, dust falling from the ceilings into your oily clump of hair, everything you own falling on top of each other, not knowing whether the walls would support you for one more night...
Sleep? Forget it.
I was too hungry to sleep anyways.
Even though I scavenged for some food yesterday, it’s not enough to suppress the constant dull ache in my stomach that just won’t. Go. Away.

I think I might scavenge a little more today, and try to find new things to kill some time. Of course I need to watch out for a lot of things that could kill me, but I think it’s worth taking that shot again.

Plus I’m really curious about the infamous internet connection people have been getting around here. Ever since the power went out and the soldiers started taking everyone’s phones, I haven’t been able to get any connection.
I was lucky that I had left my phone in the house when the soldiers stopped to frisk me for it. Any chance of me reconnecting with my family and friends would have been completely lost..
So yeah, maybe I’ll be fortunate enough to go back online for once. Contact my family and see how the rest of the world is doing. I wonder if they know anything about what’s been happening here..
After I grab some quick breakfast and a little bite for lunch, I’m going to head out. I’ll start talking again if anything interesting happens.
Hey, so I realized something just a minute ago. I’ve scavenged a LOT of places since the past year, and so have the other 350,000 people stuck here.
But has anyone checked out the nursing home at the edge of the city? Like, really. It hadn't even crossed my mind until now.
What if… there were some medical supplies and food left? Just an idea, but I have a feeling it’s a good one. Why not take the chance, right?
I’m changing my route now. Next stop: Rivercross Nursing Home.
Talk about the most depressing walk ever. It was the first time I had been in this area of the city, and… Yeah, it’s pretty bad. Had to change my route a couple of times just to get here.
Heard some machine guns going off in the distance but.. I should be fine. Yeah, I’m fine.
Rivercross isn’t in too bad of a shape in my opinion. The red brick walls are a bit crumbled in some places, but the building has been lucky enough to evade any major hits.
I wonder if anyone is still staying here. Hopefully if they are, they’ll be friendly enough to give me some rations or medical supplies.

Quickly trying several side doors to see if they’re unlocked and.. Okay yeah it looks like all the locks have been broken off or something. The chains are just uselessly hitting the door every time I move it around.
Now I’m taking a step in and… GACK WHAT’S TH- WHAT’S THAT SMELL?
Oh god… I can’t do this. I have to go outsid-
Well shit, there goes my breakfast.
Okay, I’ve been around dead bodies and rotting food, but that was just… Oh my god.. Were some people forgotten here?
No no no… Please don’t tell me that’s the case. I don’t know what I would do if I see these old people, left behind in the war..
I don’t want to do it, but something is telling me that I need to walk into this building and see how bad it is. Maybe there are some people alive that I can help?
I’m praying that’s the case.
So now I’m walking in again and..
Dead bodies. Everywhere. Either in body bags or just laid in rows, but they’re everywhere.

It looks like someone tried taking care of them for a while, and that this place was used as a hospital for others as well. I’m seeing a couple of old citizens in wheelchairs and also others who may be mentally ill..
They’re all on the brink of death, lost and mentally unavailable to the outside world. How could I-
What? Wait, did my phone just buzz in my pocket? There’s no way.. Unless..
Oh my god! I think I have a connection! It’s really weak, but it’s something! Messages won’t stop pouring in, and just.. Oh my god, I could cry right now.
Hold on, I’ll be right back.

Alright, so it looks like my family is still in South Carolina, but I’m not sure where exactly. The last message they sent was three months ago and they’ve been silent since then. Please tell me they’re still alive..

And another thing. I’m reconnected on Twitter again. I don’t have much time since the internet keeps cutting out, but.. I have a feeling the world doesn’t even know what’s going on right now? Like in the United States?
Have they.. forgotten about us? Where are all the rallies trying to stop this damned war? All this time I thought the world was trying to save us but.. No?
People are starving and being shot and bombed on and… the world has no idea. Or they don’t care. One or the other.
I need to do something, in the next several minutes. I’m starting to hear planes getting closer and closer, signaling that the next batch of bombs are going to be coming down soon.

So I could take a picture of this nursing home and post it on Twitter for the world to see, and then leave, or I could forget about it and attempt to transfer some of these patients into a safe house nearby.
Either way, I’m running out of time. Shoot, what should I do?

You know what? It’s decided. I’m going to A) take a photo of this place and post it with #ThisIsMyGreenville so the world can see. B) forget about the phone and start moving patients to a nearby safe house.
The world needs to see what is happening in this city. We cannot- no, we will not be forgotten this easily.
I know leaving these people here again is something that goes way against my conscience, but I don’t think I would have enough time to save anyone in the first place. Even if I tried.
So, might as well take a photo, upload, and leave right? To make a statement while I can?
I’ve made so many sacrifices already, and.. I think this might have to be another one of those painful kinds. The ones that play in your head on repeat when you’re trying to sleep.
I’m just.. I’m just going to get this over with. Pulling up the camera app..
Ugh, why is it taking so long? The planes have already started bombing places nearby and I’m starting to get a bit nervous.
Okay it’s open! It’s open. Now just a quick photo.
Annnnd I got it. I hope this picture will be enough to get the point across, and that it will wake people up, even if it’s just a few.

Shit shit shit, the ground around me is starting to shake now and I really need to get some proper cover. But this internet connection.. What if I can only get it from this building? I need to post this photo, NOW.
My.. my hands are shaking.. C’mon Twitter, work for me one last time..
Bam! Got it! Now for the caption…
“The old and mentally ill, forgotten. Where is the rest of the world? Why aren’t you guys trying to save us? #ThisIsMyGreenville”
And… just like that, it’s finally posted.
Also.. I think it might be the last thing I post, ever.

I’m taking cover under table right now, but I don’t think it’s going to be enough to protect me against these bombs. It’s too late for me to get out now, or to do anything to protect myself if the building is hit.
The explosions and tremors just keep getting closer… and closer…an-
Ha, my mom would be so proud of me right now.
She would always go on tangents about how she hated the fact that I would always be on my phone instead of doing "better things."
Looks like I’ve matured a bit, Mom.
Right, so I’m running out of time. Even though the planes still sound a bit farther away, I need to get out of here as soon as possible.
I’ll only be able to take a few with me for now, but hopefully I’ll be quick enough to come back with assistance to pick up the rest of the people before it’s too late.
Looks like I’ll be taking this old man in a wheelchair and another lady nearby with me first. Kinda feeling bad that I can’t be super gentle with them, but we REALLY need to go.
So now I’m running back outside, and.. Shit, the planes are way closer than I originally thought.
Okay, I really need to focus. Where was the safe house again? I think it was to my right but.. Screw it, that’s where we’re going. No time for second guesses.
I’ll turn the recorder back on when I get there.
I’m… back… geez.. I can.. barely.. breathe…
Haven’t ran.. that fast.. in a.. while..
Phew.. Okay, so I’m here at their entrance and I’ve knocked as loud as possible since they might all be down in the bunkers. Please please PLEASE someon-
Thank god! Yes!

“I have no time to truly explain, but I need a few helping hands to transfer people left in the nursing home back here before the bombs start raining down on them! I know you guys have a lot of people already, bu-”
“Yes? YES? Oh thank you so much. We need to go right now, bring as many people as you can!”
Wow, I can’t believe that I’m actually still alive. That was one of the closest times I’ve been to death, I’m pretty sure.
Back in my shabby old room/bunker right now, and I haven’t felt relief like this in a while. Even though I’m fighting to survive everyday, that experience was something I’ll never forget.
So I know I cut the recorder off after the safe house people agreed to help, but we were able to get around five extra men to come along and get the rest of the people out in time.
They agreed to take care of patients for now, and also gave me some freshly baked bread for me to take home and eat later.
They also told me that it was brave of me to have gone through all of that to save these people, and that I was always welcome there if I needed a place to stay.
Amazing, right? Still don’t know what took over me to do such a thing, but hey, looks like it was all worth it in the end.
After I clean up a bit, I’m heading to bed. Geez, talk about an exhaustive day.
How the hell am I still alive? No, really, someone please answer me.
Around 30 minutes ago, my house was finally hit. The bombers finally found our faded yellow house hidden between the trees, and immediately showered it with love.
And when they did, I was still unfortunately inside, unconscious with exhaustion.
Worst thing about being in this situation is the first few seconds; you don’t know if you’re still dreaming or if death had finally caught up to you after being evaded for so long.
But then your instincts kick in, and as everything around you starts to quickly crumble down, you immediately take cover and pray to God with everything you have.
I was lucky. Even while my safehaven disintegrated into dust before my eyes, my life stayed protected under my father’s old metal work bench, which had been placed next to my bed… just in case.
The bombers thankfully didn’t focus on my house any further after that. They left me alone in a half-collapsed room, with just enough space for me to escape with the most important items I possessed.
Along with my journal, recorder, and phone, I was able to pick up things like chargers, pills, and extra clothes from the rubble. But everything else…
Goodbye books. Goodbye pictures. Goodbye wallpaper I grew up with. Goodbye family memories and comfort. Goodbye home.
I need to keep reminding myself to stay focused and determined to keep on going. Because the second you lose the will to live, you’re out. And that’s not going to happen to me.
This is only the beginning.
So now, I’m here. Under the roof of another house, not knowing what to do.
I’m really glad that I was able to scavenge this recorder and journal out though. Would have been anticlimactic to have been found with only three entries, amiright?
A part of me just wants to cry and scream and yell at the sky asking why, why is this happening to me? Why is this happening to all of us? Why…?

But then I remember that I’ve been asking this question for about a year now, which is still unanswered to this day. And so I get my shit together, and keep on going. Just to survive a little more. Just to fight a little more.
So, I’ve come up with my next plan of action. The safe house I went to yesterday? Looks like it’s going to be my new home for a while.
They have food, shelter, clothing, and I don’t know.. just people I can talk to, for once. I have a feeling that would be the best medicine for a situation like this.
And so off I go, into the morning light covered completely in white concrete dust and shrouded with screams of those afar who encountered a much more tragic fate.
Alright, so I think I’ll be reaching the safe house in a minute or so. The bombs from last night have torn up the streets a bit, but I somehow managed to find this small secluded building again.
Should be around this corn-
Oh, f***. Nononono are they who I think they are? Is the only support system I have left going to be taken away from me now, when I need it the most?
Okay, so I’m hiding behind this corner to stay away from the safe house entrance because… Well because there’s another group heading for the entrance. To further clarify, it’s…
It’s a group of US Government soldiers.
How the hell did they even get into our city? I thought the whole purpose of blockading the city entrances was to keep out the US government soldiers..?
Maybe TLC is finally starting to weaken a little bit, after fighting for so long.
But what is happening right now is not good. The soldiers haven’t seen me yet, but I can tell by their body language that they’re about to pounce, almost like a cat with prey right before it’s eyes.
Oh my god. All those people inside? They’re going to die.
I have heard enough horror stories from outside sources to know what the government soldiers are really capable of… and what they are about to do.
What the hell do I do?
They’ve started pounding on the door and shouting.. It’s a matter of seconds until they make it in.
I want to help those people… but how? I’m outnumbered with a machete in my hand, which feels a lot smaller now compared to the machine guns carried by the soldiers.
Maybe in this case, approaching them peacefully is the best solution? No, really.

The soldiers just want to check the inside of the safe house to see if any TLC members are hiding, right? So if I went up to them calmly and helped create a compromise, it could possibly prevent unnecessary deaths..
Hmm.. and for the compromise, I would say that the people within the safe house will peacefully come out and let the soldiers search inside, if everyone is left unharmed.

I mean, it would get the job done. But then at the same time.. The US soldiers could be cold-hearted, or unforgiving, or... just unnecessarily ruthless. And the end result could be that we all die.. Including me.
So does that mean I walk away? Like nothing happened? Or do I just go for it, and risk it all? A) Try to intervene and save their lives. B) Walk away and find better shelter.
Yeah, that’s gotta be the right decision. I mean, would I even be able to live with myself if I just got up and left? If this is what I die for, then at least it was for a good cause.
I’m terrified but… Screw it, I’m going now. Just gotta leave the machete to show that I mean no harm.
Crossing my fingers and… slowly taking those few steps forward. I’ve gone through a lot of shit in my life, but this is one of the scariest things I have ever done.
Inhale. Exhale. Alright, time to speak up.
“Hello? Excuse me? I mean no harm I ju-.. Woah woah woah no seriously, I mean no-”
*Gunshots*
I’m such a coward. Selfish. Weak.
The logical part of my brain is telling me that it would have been a fruitless attempt to convince the soldiers, and that it would have resulted in a massacre with me as part of the casualty.
But the other half… it won’t stop overflowing with guilt. The ‘what ifs’ are just repeating over and over like a messed up never-ending record player..

The worst part though, were the screams that echoed throughout the cities several minutes after I left. One of the worst sounds that will make you want to curl up in a ball and cry and cry and cry till you disappear, is the scream of someone about to die.
You can hear the pain, the sadness, the fear, and the desperation of wanting it all to stop, wanting it all to just be a horrific nightmare, and wanting to LIVE.
I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I’m sorry.
That’s all I can say. That’s all I can think.
I’m sorry.
My head hurts, my vision is blurry, and I haven’t been able to stop shivering. Not sure if these are just symptoms of starvation, or mental/physical side effects of what happened yesterday.
To be simply put, I’m currently a mess. Last night I ended up finding a small building for shelter, but it’s definitely temporary. It’s so flimsy I’d be dead in an instant if a bomb hit.

My hair isn’t even hair anymore. It’s just a clump of oil, dirt, and sweat that hasn’t been groomed in days. I’m also still completely covered in dust from yesterday. Haven’t had the energy to clean up, I guess.
Desperate. Disoriented. Deprived. Disheveled. There are so many negative adjectives that could describe the state I’m in right now, it’s pretty amusing.
Where do I go? What do I do next? What’s the poin- no wait, not even going to try asking that question.
I… I think I need to eat first. Even if it’s just 200g of rice, I feel like it’ll help somehow. Praying the Red Cross hasn’t run out of food yet..
And then after I eat, maybe I’ll try finding better shelter for the night. Something more resilient, and more permanent.
I know I’ve got it in me to survive at least one more day.
You know, human interactions are so nice. Even if it’s just a small smile or a casual conversation about recent attacks, having that connection with someone blankets you with relief.
Maybe it’s because I’ve been alone for too long. Not having anyone to joke around with, or cry with, or even argue with feels.. asphyxiating.
I miss my family. My friends. My teachers. My neighbors. Hell, I even miss the mailman that was assigned to our neighborhood.
And most of all, I miss school. Never thought that would ever come out of my mouth, but I would kill to learn again.
The books I had stocked up in my bunker helped suppress those feelings a bit, well, until it was blasted into bits. I couldn’t even finish ‘Seveneves’.
When I got my handful of rice from the Red Cross, I tried asking if they had any books I could borrow. Of course, I came back empty-handed, but they did tell me something interesting..
Apparently some kids around here (or maybe teenagers? Or both?) still go to school in this city! How insane is that? Some teachers must’ve been unable to leave Greenville in time.
I didn’t ask for details, but I’m kinda tempted to check it out. I really need something else on my mind other than survival, pain, and death.

Speaking of survival, the sun is setting and I haven’t found a nice stable shelter yet. Either the houses are already occupied with a large family, or shredded to pieces by previous bomb blasts. Pretty much nothing in between.
I could definitely go back to the flimsy building for another night but.. Damn, I really thought a day would be enough to find a new place to stay around here.
But 350,000 of us all stuck in this city? I guess it’s understandable.
It really is getting dark though. Being stuck in the city at night without any proper shelter is the one thing I will avoid at all costs.

Not knowing if a random sniper bullet will fly by your head or if a landmine will go off while you’re not looking just sounds like a death sentence to me. So I’m gonna have to hurry, to make it back on time.
I know several shortcuts, and I think the route that passes underneath the Highway 123 Bridge would be the quickest. Hopefully the bridge is still intact, and not a skeleton of what it used to be.
Huh, whaddaya know. Not all of Greenville is destroyed after all.
Other than some cracks here and there, the bridge looks pretty intact and is just how I remembered it. I mean I wouldn’t want to sleep under here, but at least my safety isn’t in imminent danger.

Honestly, I can’t even guarantee that. My body’s so food deprived I’m pretty sure my sense of judgement has gone off the deep end. Everything is just a haze and it’s getting harder and harder to think straight.
There’s also some old tents here and there, but I’m pretty sure they’ve been uninhabited for a long time. I mean, who would think it’s a good idea to sleep under an unstable bridge?
Shoot, I’d rather sleep out in the open than under tons of collapsible concrete.
And… ha, looks like I’m starting to hallucinate too. I’m seeing a small smashed cereal box or something near the tents, and it still looks like there’s something inside.
Might be a waste of energy, but I’m going to go take a look. Gotta have a little hope, right?
Yes, oh thank god, finally something I can eat. The box has an expired bag of old corn flakes inside, but I’m pretty positive it’s still edible!
Man, talk about luck.
Even though I just want to demolish the bag right now, I should get moving. The sun is really starting to set and I think I have less than 30 minutes befo-
“Woah woah woah, please, put the gun down. I really mean no harm. Why-”
“Oh, you want this? The box of cereal? But I just found this and I’m star-”
“Could we share? No? Wait, is this your family behind you? Are you really willing to shoot me in front of your children? Really?”
“...oh, it’s been done before..”
“Anything to protect your family? Sheesh, what has this world come to?”

“Alright, well A) your children need the food more than me. Here are the cornflakes.” B) I’m sorry but I can’t give you these cornflakes. You wouldn’t shoot me in front of your kids, I know you wouldn’t.”
Man, talk about luck.
After I gave them the cereal I was able to run off pretty quickly, so at least I’m safe for now.
But how did I not hear them coming? I think that was the first time someone had snuck up on me like that.. Geez, the starvation side effects must be hitting me pretty hard.
I think I made the right decision though. Those two kids really needed the food, and also my life is more important than cornflakes..
Kinda ironic, isn’t it? My life is more important than what I need to live. Nice.
I’m scared of tomorrow, and what it’ll bring. The past few days has made it harder and harder for me to survive, and I don’t know what I’ll do if things get any worse.
*Gunshots*
And just like that.. they leave. They shot someone and left them to die all alone for a box of cereal.
And just like that.. I’m on the brink of death. Don’t even know if the voice recorder is picking up my whispers but.. I’m going to die, I already know it.
Life’s unfair.. There were still so many.. things I wanted.. to do.
I wish I.. could see my family.. one last time..
I wish I.. could play soccer.. with my best friends.. one last time..
I just.. wish.. I could see.. the sky.. one last.. time..
...I wish…
So last night I thought long and hard about how to improve my situation, and I came up with three, very straightforward conclusions:
1) Find some food to eat.
2) Find a secure place to stay.
3) Find a better weapon. Yesterday’s encounter was one of the biggest wakeup calls I’ve ever had, and now I know the uselessness of a machete in this city.

Once I acquire all three things, I’m hoping it’ll help me finally get a good night’s sleep for once. The past few nights have been consumed with paranoia and hunger, and it’s really starting to show on my body.

First things first; I’m going to quickly run by the Red Cross to get my daily handful of rice, then once I eat that I’ll begin my miniature expedition. Breakfast is the most important meal of the day, right? Can’t skip it.
Just gotta grab my backpack and.. I’m on my way.
Yes.
Yes yes YES! God I could scream and jump in the air and celebrate right now, I’m so happy. Actually, more relieved than happy.
I finally found a perfect place to stay, and it’s got everything I need for protection.
Safety from intruders? Check.
Safety from the outside weather? Check.
Place to hide my stuff and possibly usable as a permanent home? Check.
Bomb-resistant? Check? Hopefully?
I mean, it’s underground and looks pretty durable/stable to me.
This place is so perfect… Where could I possibly be?
The expectantly grandiose answer is actually quite plain and simple; I’m currently standing at the entrance of an open bank vault.

Yep, that’s right. I passed by the bank on my way to the Red Cross and the thought just ran through my head as a possibility. I mean, once all the money has been taken, what other use does it have, right?

Not gonna lie, I was terrified when I first walked in. I mean, it could have already been inhabited, and my most recent encounters with other humans have been pretty.. unpleasant? To say the least. So I wasn’t sure what to expect.
But the place is empty. Barren. The bank vault was left wide open with every single dollar inside taken out. (Yes, I checked.)
I really don’t know how to completely lock the vault door from the inside, but I think I could barricade it shut every night to prevent any intruders attempting to get in.
Hey, it’s a lot better than what I have now. Hopefully it’ll at least last me a couple of weeks or so. It would be some messed up shit if I lost it in a day or two.
Even though I’m really reluctant to leave this place, I still have to go stop by the Red Cross camp to get my 200g of rice. I feel like my body’s going to give out if I don’t eat something soon..
F***. I’m so screwed. My final nightmare has come to life in the worst timing possible.

The Red Cross is out of food. Like, completely out of everything. I could tell they weren’t lying because of the look of despair in all the workers’ eyes. They were trying their best to look calm but.. They’re out.
Once the Red Cross is out, then you know the city’s safety is out of the question. Chaos is going to be ruling the streets for the next several weeks. Pandemonium, it’s accomplice.
More robberies. More shootings.
More death.
Don’t want to be pessimistic, but.. I’m starting to see Death a lot more clearly in the near future. My luck’s gotta run out someday.

Oh, and here’s something ironic. The workers at the Red Cross told me I could buy some food at some of the stores still open around here, which gave me a bit of hope, until I took a look at the prices and..
It’s so absurd, it’s laughable. Everything in the market is inflated by 300%.
So a loaf of bread? $10. A pound of white rice? Pshh, it’s gone up pretty much 500%, and is currently at $8.50.
Doesn’t sound too bad, until you realize that you have no job or money because of.. Oh I don’t know, the war?
And what’s ironic is that I’m literally staying in a bank for the next several weeks.
Life is just..
So many things I could say. But I need to focus and come up with a plan of action, or I really might die in the next several days.
Y’know, I think I might check out the Reedy River area, since I haven’t been there in so long. Maybe luck will be on my side again.
I really just need to find SOMETHING to eat.
I’ve walked around this war-torn area for an hour now, and there are only two things that I have found that could be possible nourishment options.
Leaves. And water, from the Reedy River.
Both are things I would never consider consuming, unless I was on the brink of death.
Well, I’m pretty much there. Or at least I will be, unless I get something in my system.
You know you’re desperate when you consider eating raw leaves or drinking water from the Reedy River as a means of survival.
The leaves don’t look too bad. Some are covered in white dust from the collapse of nearby buildings, but that’s about it damage-wise.
The water on the other hand, is.. sickening. Not only is it a murky-white (because of the concrete), but it’s also got questionable items floating around in it that just screams out “DON’T DRINK”.
The only problem is, I need water. I’m running out, and if I don’t get something to drink, I really could die. Don’t they say you can survive longer without eating than drinking?
So I need to decide on which one to consume. I’m not doing both, because I’m a bit afraid my body won’t be able to handle it all at once.
I’m so hungry… Yet, I’m so thirsty too..
Even though I hate making this decision, I think I’ll A) drink the Reedy River water. B) eat leaves from nearby trees.
God, I really shouldn’t be doing this. I might as well drink poison to be honest.
Let me go find the most ‘cleanest’ spot and.. Alright, I’m putting some in my water bottle.
Hm, it actually doesn’t look as bad as I thought! The water is only a slight tint of white, and it doesn’t really smell that bad.
Lemme take a sip and… Oh, yep, disgusting.
But honestly if I pinch my nose and try not to taste it, it could work!
Even though I’ll be going to bed hungry, at least I’ll be somewhat hydrated.
I’ll come back tomorrow for leaves if my body is still functioning after tonight.
And now off I go, back to my secure bank vault.
I’m back at the vault, and I have never felt so sick in my life. I thought that wasn’t even possible, after all the shit I’ve been through.
But drinking that water was a definite.. mistake. I can’t stop throwing up, and I think I’m starting to have a fever?
I’m just.. going to sleep for a bit.. and see what happens. God.. I hope I wake up tomorrow..
It’ll taste just like a salad.. Just pretend it’s covered in Italian dressing with some fresh tomatoes on the side, and maybe some parmesan cheese sprinkled on top..
Nope, not working.
I can’t believe I’m doing this. I’ve wiped off most of the white powder on the leaves, and I’ve tried coaxing myself into wanting to eat them, but they still look insanely unappetizing.
I’m back at the vault now, with a huge bag of picked leaves right in front of me.
I was planning to cook the leaves to make them more edible, well, until I realized I have nothing to cook it with. So it looks like I’m eating each leaf raw.
First bite…
...Hm. Maybe it’s because I’m hungry, but it’s not as bad as I thought it would be. Yeah it’s gross, and it gets progressively bitter the more you chew, but it’s not gag-worthy.

I think I can do this. I’ll force myself to eat.. I don’t know, 20 leaves? Is that enough to sustain me for a night? And then I’m going to bed. I have a feeling my body’s going to need as much rest as possible to digest something so fiber-rich.
I have a slight feeling tomorrow morning isn’t going to be pretty.
Never doing that AGAIN. My body has never rejected something so hard in my life.
This morning I woke up to the overpowering feeling of … regurgitation. And so instead of fighting it, I just went with the flow.
And now, I’m staring directly at an odorous greenish yellowish heap in the middle of my newly-acquired room. Lovely.
Knew it wasn’t a good idea to do it, but I went ahead and did it anyways. It was probably way better than drinking the river water though.. That looked way too toxic for my body.
Looks like I’m back at square one. Empty stomach, slow physical and mental deterioration.. Nothing new.

Oh, but one thing was different! I was actually able to sleep a couple of hours last night! How exciting is that? And the only thing that really woke me up was the bombings that were occurring nearby.
Thankfully we weren’t hit, but I have a feeling all the roads and buildings outside are going to be demolished. If it’s bright enough, maybe I’ll go on a quick walk to see how things look.
I need to go find more ‘food’ for myself anyways.
So it seems like we were slightly hit last night. The front lobby of the bank was completely crushed and it took me around 15 minutes of rubble-digging to get out.

But it’s nothing major. I created a small path so it would be easier for me to get in and out. On the bright side, I think it makes it harder for others to find the bank vault, which means… more security! Exactly what I need at this point.
I’m currently walking over pieces of cars, buildings, signs.. you name it. This whole area has become a melting pot of what used to make up Greenville.
Is it just me, or have the bombings gotten more intense recently? I wonder if TLC is slowly losing control of the city.. God, I really hope that’s the case.
This war is just… sickening.
We civilians are paying the cost of this terrible war, which we had nothing to do with and didn’t decide to be a part of. We are the most vulnerable of the vulnerable..
And no side is protecting us.
I just wish.. I just wish.. I.. I don’t know what I’m exactly wishing for.
Just for this to- oh wait, is that a box of crackers?
Talk about a sudden topic change, but I think I hit the jackpot! Just found a whole box of half-smashed (but edible) saltine crackers under a piece of rubble I knocked over.
Shoot, I’m eating these crackers NOW. I’m so food-deprived, I’m pretty sure my body’s just running on pure adrenaline at this point. And last time I waited to eat.. I never did.
....urmph.. Oh my god… This is the best thing I’ve ever eaten I swear.. God I could eat the who-
...Wait, what was that?
Holy shit, so I don’t know how to say this but um.. I just.. I just pulled a child out from the rubble.
He looks like he’s 6 years old and I don’t know his name because he’s semiconscious and unresponsive.. Probably still in a state of shock.

He has a huge gash on the side of his head so I need to act quickly. I wonder if any of his family members are buried nearby or have made it out.. Hold on, I see some people over there, maybe they’ll be some help.
We searched everywhere for more people, but.. nothing. Either they made it out on their own or they’re… Yeah.
I asked why the Red Cross wasn’t here to help since they’re usually at bombed areas pulling people out, and they told me it was probably to avoid another possible trap.
Apparently the last time the medical team went to a bomb site, around 13 of their workers died.
Knowing that the Red Cross would arrive to help those in bombed areas, the US Government waited around 30 minutes to come back and drop even more bombs in the same area.
It was a trap, and a deadly one too.
So now I’m here with this child, not really sure what to do. I mean, I tried my best to clean and close up his wounds with the small medical kit I had in my bag, but what next?

I mean, he’s probably an orphan now, right? Should I take him back to the bank vault and care for him for the next couple of days? Or should I take him to the group of people back there and see if they’ll take care of him instead..?
I just.. I don’t know if I could handle the responsibility of taking care of a child right now. I mean, I’m struggling to support myself.. How would I even feed the both of us?
But at the same time, he might just be pushed aside if I leave him with the others, and maybe die from the lack of assistance? This could possibly mean more blood on my hands, right?
No no no no I can’t handle more guilt.. I can’t.. But I also can’t support the both of us..
What am I supposed to do?
Aw screw it, I’m going to A) take the child to the others and go search for more food. B) take the child back to the bank vault.
Do I feel guilty for leaving him like that?
Yes… and no. Yes, because his safety is uncertain and I could have just left him with a group of perilous humans who end up completely neglecting his existence and well-being.
No, because.. Well would it have been any better if he was with me instead? I mean I would care for him, but his safety wouldn’t be guaranteed and.. what if his death became my responsibility?
I have a feeling something like that on my conscience would send me straight to the grave.
So that was the right decision. It’s all going to be okay. I just need to keep to myself and survive long enough to get out of this hellhole in one piece.
Attachment to other people.. could become fatal.
So take a deep breath. In, and out. Focus. I need to find food. These crackers won’t last me long enough, and avoiding the consumption of unsavory vegetation is currently my number one priority.

I’ve been contemplating about where to search for food and.. I think just walking around this area is a good idea. Why? Because there’s probably a higher chance of me finding food in the rubble than in the barren buildings nearby.
I just have to go back to the-
Oh f***. That soun- no no no no the planes are back the planes are ba-
Oh f***. That soun- no no no no the planes are back the planes are ba-
I’m not going to make it I’m not going to make it I’M NOT GOING TO MAKE IT-
His name is Tobias, apparently.

While on our way back to the bank vault, he woke up for a few minutes and said a few words here and there. He said his head hurt, and I told him I would give him some medicine when we got back to safety so he would feel better.
And after that, he was knocked out again in my arms. Half of me is pissed at myself for taking the responsibility of becoming a guardian, and the other half thinks it’s the right decision.
Maybe it’s because I saw my younger brother in his eyes. I don’t know. But I just couldn’t leave him all alone out in the middle of such.. misery and despair.
We’ll survive. I’ll make sure we will.
Right now he’s sleeping on some blankets I found in the back office, and I’m just waiting for him to wake up. I saved half of the crackers too just in case he was hungry.
Huh, it’s only been several hours, but it looks like I’m already putting his needs before mine. I guess this is kinda what being a parent feels like.
I’m going to regret this. I already know it.
Wow. I’ve gotta say, bringing Tobias back here was quite possibly one of the best decisions I’ve ever made in my life.
For two reasons, actually.
First reason: the second we settled down last night, the ground began to shake. Either it was another government air raid, or some missile attacks, or… multiple shellings? I’m not sure.
All I know is that some shit went down last night, and if I hadn’t left with Tobias.. Well, let’s just say we wouldn’t be eating crackers right now for breakfast.
Second reason: my mental health feels a million times better already. Seriously.

Surviving alone for a year really had its consequences, but this kid’s sudden presence just kinda.. I dunno, makes me forget the feeling of defeat. How could I give up if a six year old is fighting with every-
“Hmm? This? Oh, this is my recorder! I talk into it everyday about my day so I don’t forget what happened. Pretty cool, huh? Wanna play with it? Here-”
Heh, so yeah that was Tobi. He’s still in a lot of pain and I’m fairly certain he has a concussion, but it looks like my mediocre medical kit is actually really helping with the healing process.
I cleaned and stitched up the gash on his head last night to avoid an infection and.. yeah that wasn’t pleasant. At all. But at least I know he won’t get sick from that.
I’ve been trying to think of a plan on getting him to a Red Cross camp for further medical assistance (just in case), and also on finding more food, but it’s been.. tough, to say the least.
Moving him around too much would be dangerous until he’s gained some strength, so finding food and water for the both of us has become more of a priority. The question is, where would I go…?
Even though I absolutely despise the idea, I’ll probably have to leave him here alone for several hours to go scavenge around.

I mean, there’s no other alternative I can think of. So I’ll have to explain to him and make it extremely quick. Maybe I’ll let him draw in the last several pages of my journal or something so he won’t get bored too quickly.
Phew, alright, let’s do this.
I need to think, quick. Not panic, no no no, focus, think.
After finally convincing him, I left Tobi in the bank vault and climbed up the cluttered stairs into the lobby of the bank.
Everything looked the same destruction-wise except for additional sizable chunks of concrete on the ground, which had somehow flew through the bulletproof windows with enough force.
So the windows were broken. No big deal, right? But then I peered outside through the smashed holes and looked directly into the eyes of my executioner.
LOTUS, and their use of chemical weapons. I’d heard about it before, but never truly believed it.
Well, it’s true. Orange smoke was quickly spreading everywhere from a cannister, obscuring everything in sight nearby.
And almost to confirm its legitimacy, I swear I faintly saw a large LOTUS flag through the bright toxic blanket.
They’re here. I never thought they would make it this far, but the militants somehow broke through the TLC blockade and made it into our city.
And they’re not just here, no, they’re RIGHT HERE, in OUR SECTOR of the city. Maybe several hundred meters away.

The next decision I’m going to have to make is truly going to determine whether we live or die. Well, maybe not even live. There’s a high chance that both decisions will get us killed, but I’ve got no choice. It’s this or nothing.

So the first option I have is to stay hidden, here in this bank vault. The chance of the militants right outside finding us in here is pretty slim, and I feel like the vault doors are thick enough to seal the toxic gas out of our room.
Unless the militants are looking through every single room of every building and capturing people, I honestly think it’s not a bad gamble.
We would just need to stay quiet for several hours, or maybe days, and I mean, we’re underground so we would be difficult to find, right?
Hmm.
And, well, the other option is to make a run for it. Sounds ridiculous, but if we leave now we still have a fair chance at escaping. The only problem we have is.. Tobi’s condition.

He’s unstable, he can’t walk, and I don’t know if carrying him while running will jarr his body around too much. And what if the air around the building is already contaminated? Will a cloth over our noses and mouths be enough?
What if I can’t even see because it’s so polluted? And what if there’s nowhere to go? What if the entire city is already enveloped with this chemical substance?
This option would be significantly more dangerous, but I would have total control of our actions and we wouldn’t be sitting ducks.
I only have a machete against their powerful weapons, so if they were to come in, I wouldn’t be able to defend us...
The clock’s ticking and I feel like the outside commotion is getting closer. I can hear gunshots and shouts, and just..
Focus.
Alright, yeah, that’s gotta be the better option. We’re going to A) make a run for it. B) hide in the bank vault till the commotion is over.
Do I have everything? Medical kit? Check. Blankets? Check. Crackers? Check.
Is Tobi’s face and body completely protected? Yes, check. Mine? Not really, but there’s nothing I can do about it. I’m sure.. I’m sure I’ll be fine.
I’ve got everything. We’re ready. Now our lives are ultimately in the hands of my strength and good fortune. It’s terrifying, the pressure, but.. there’s really no other choice.
Opening the vault door and.. alright, here we go.
..Mustard..
Sulfur mustard.. That’s what it...
Hold on.. I need to catch my.. breath..

...Wow. My body’s currently stinging in random places, but I don’t have the energy to look. And well, my eyes are still watering pretty badly, so it’s.. it’s really hard to keep my eyes open for longer than a second.
But we were lucky. The gas barely touched us as we left the bank building, and I think it actually acted as some form of opaque shield that just completely obscured our presence.
We’re safe. Well, for now at least. We’re away from the gas and the militants, and.. and we were able to travel far enough so that we entered a completely different.. sector of the city.
But geez, that took a toll on my body. I can barely move my arms and legs, and it’s really hard to focus on.. just about everything.
All I know is that we’re sprawled out next to large dumpster in a random alleyway, right out in the open with no real protection.
I wish I could have found a better form of shelter but.. My willpower wasn’t enough to keep my body going.

Thankfully Tobias is unharmed, and in almost a better condition than I am. After several minutes of just sitting, he took off the makeshift face-cover and began slowly walking around, exploring the area.
He helped me clean out my eyes with our limited water supply, and now.. What’s he doing? Based on the noises coming from the dumpster, I think he might be.. looking for.. food?
Heh, he’s almost more responsible.. than I am.. I don’t know.. My eyelids are just.. feeling so… heavy..
Even though I hate patiently waiting and doing nothing, I don’t regret making this decision.
It’s the best for Tobi, and the safest decision in my opinion. I mean, this bank building is barely visible with all the rubble, and looks completely uninhabited.

They would literally have to climb through all the rubble, walk through the half-collapsed walls, and search all the back rooms to find this vault. I mean seriously, unless they’ve got time on their hands, I highly doub-
Wait. Okay. So this might just be sudden paranoid me speaking, but isn’t it also a possibility that they would search every nook and cranny in this building for money?
I’d heard in past about how they were bombing banks for money, and how they were always struggling to find enough funding to support their camps and weaponry..
No way. That won’t happen. It can’t happen. You can barely even tell from the outside that it’s a bank.. I think..
And I can’t really blockade the door because there’s nothing heavy inside this room that can be moved around, and if I open the vault to get items, well, the toxic air coul-
“Wait- shhh Tobi. Shhhh.”
What. Was. That.
I just thought I heard..
“Hey, hey it’s okay Tobi, calm down, it’s okay.”
“We mean no harm, please, spare our-”
“He’s 6… and I’m-”
“What? Am I a what? Oh, a Christian? Am I a Christian?” A) “Yes, I am.” B) “No, I’m not.”
“I am. What? Why hadn’t I joined LOTUS earlier?”
“Because LOTUS does not represent true Christianity.”
“Us true Christians are not murderers. We are not thieves. We do not kidnap, and we do not torture. LOTUS views are contorted and is NOT what I believe in. We are a religion of Love, NOT hate.”
“Ha, right. That makes me an infidel? Is that right?”
“Wait where- where are you taking him? nO NO NO DON’T TAKE HIM NO HE CAN’T BE WITH PEOPLE LIKE YO-”
*Gunshots*
“Wha- what? I’m filled with sin? Is that right?”
“Then tell me this: I’ve never killed. I’ve never stolen. I’ve never kidnapped, nor have I ever tortured. Have you?”
“No, those are just excuses. Your answers should be yes, you have. And I haven’t. If those don’t count as sin, but me not joining a Christian extremist group is a sin, then yes, I am a sinner.”
“Wait where- where are you taking him? No, he has nothing to do with this.. nO NO NO DON’T TAKE HIM NO HE CAN’T BE WITH PEOPLE LIKE YO-”
*Gunshots*
Y’know the feeling you get during those first few seconds of consciousness after you wake up from a falling dream?
You’re terrified and disoriented, and you find yourself grasping for any form of evidence proving that what you just went through was all in fact, a dream.

My eyes were glued shut when I regained consciousness this morning, and once those first few seconds passed with my eyelids still undivided, a shudder of adrenaline quaked through my body faster than I could comprehend.
I thought I was permanently blind, for some reason. I don’t know. It all made sense to me at the time.

But now, after minutes of peeling and prying, I’m elated to say that inference is indeed, false. My eyelids are still a bit crusty and sore from yesterday’s experience, but my vision is thankfully unimpaired.
I’ve never fallen asleep during a voice recording before. And honestly, I’ve never fallen asleep so unprotected and out-in-the-open either.
I mean seriously, I was just draped against the wall like a wet towel, and even left Tobi completely unattended in a dump- Oh shit, wait, where is he?
Owowowow sheesh- My body really just doesn’t want to work with me today..
“T-Tobi? Where are you bud?”
“Tob- Oh.”

Phew, ha, yeah okay he’s fine. But damn, yesterday’s breakout must’ve really exhausted him.. Don’t know if it’s adorable or sad to see him fast asleep in the middle of food-scrounging, but.. Thank goodness he’s safe.
“Hey, good morning bud.. Hmm? You’re still sleepy? Alright, come here, sleep on my lap instead. It’ll be a lot more comfortable, I promise.”
Alright, I’m gonna have to whisper for now since Tobias is sleeping. I really don’t know how he’s able to sleep in conditions like this, but I‘m glad he’s getting some hours in.
He’s going to need as much rest as possible.. Especially now that I’ve decided that we’re going to leave the city.
Wow, that sounds bat-shit crazy when said outloud. But I think we really have no choice at this point.
A few minutes after moving Tobi to the ground, I took a look around our surroundings and.. I think most of our city is uninhabitable at this point.
LOTUS hit the northern and southern areas pretty hard, and all I see are puffs of deadly orange and yellow slowly drifting in this direction.
If we don’t somehow find a way to leave this besieged city soon.. We’re going to end up in more pain than I was in yesterday. And I had barely even touched the air then..
I.. I can’t let that happen to us.

The only places in Greenville that haven’t really been affected yet are in the eastern and western directions from here.. Aka the directions that lead directly towards the Liberty Corps base and LOTUS themselves.
Even though we’ll be targeted by snipers and landmines, and even though my body is aching with blisters and exhaustion, it’s come to the point where we have no other choice.
So by the time Tobias wakes up and we’ve eaten the remaining crushed crackers, I’ll have to have made a decision: Which direction do I go into next?
If I go west towards LOTUS, that.. would just be really sick joke. The area is now a total warzone with TLC on a constant offense, trying to push them back out.

But at the same time they just entered our city, and so they probably don’t know all the escape routes that need to guarded yet… And since they have militants of their own in that area, they wouldn’t randomly release chemical toxins into the air, right?
Even though I hate considering it, it’s definitely something we could work with.
The other option is to go east towards the main Liberty Corps base. The mustard gas and LOTUS hasn’t reached them yet, well.. simply because they can’t.
The Liberty Corps’ base defense is known for its impenetrability, and even the US Government has been wrestling with it for a year.

If we were to go into this direction, we wouldn’t have to worry about the chemical toxins affecting our bodies, but.. We could still be killed immediately by TLC weapons or US airstrikes or… just about anything.

Let’s just say, it would be significantly harder to survive or to escape the city through this area. But they could also be so distracted by LOTUS and US Government attacks, that we’ll be able to maybe slide right through..?
I don’t know. This is hard. It, again, purely depends on luck and chance.
Geez, I never liked gambling, and I never will.
...Yeah, okay. Looking at both circumstances, I think we’ll be most successful if we: A) go westward towards LOTUS. B) go eastward towards TLC.
So uh, something unexpected happened. Something that.. resulted in me currently driving a car towards the border of the city.
Yeah, okay, I hate it when I forget to turn the recorder on because I now have to recount all the past events that happened, and.. It’s a just pain to do so.

But to quickly summarize, after realizing the distance we have to cover to reach the western border of Greenville, I kinda panicked. We had no real food and water left to support us, and I knew my body would give out sooner or later.
So then I started searching for an alternative, something like a bicycle or even an abandoned grocery cart that would help relieve some of the load I had to carry.
But that was when I found our pot of gold, parked perfectly against the curb of a nearby street.
Even with its surroundings half-collapsed and torn down, this dark green car was almost in an impeccable condition, with only a few bumps and scratches here and there.

After breaking a window and taking a few minutes to jump start it, Tobi and I were on our way. And that’s where we are right now. Just casually driving towards the edge of the city like it’s no big deal.

Okay, obviously it’s not as simple as that. It’s been almost a year since I’ve last driven, and also most of the roads are covered with random pieces of rubble, so.. let’s just say it’s taken a lot of patience and concentration to get this far.

But it’s worth it. We’ve gotten so much farther than we would have on foot, and all I have to keep an eye on is the ground and the sky. Wouldn’t want to be stuck in a car during an air-raid.. That would just.. Yeah, let’s just not think about that.
Oh yeah! I forgot the best part about this whole ordeal! Tobi was crawling around in the back, and he found several old health bars and a half-empty water bottle on the floor!
Even though they’re stale, it’ll help in keeping us energized for tonight and tomorrow morning. We’re also going to try our best to ration out the water too.
Y’know, even though Tobi’s six years old, he’s a lot more understanding and patient than any other child I’ve interacted with in years. Seriously. I got really lucky with this kid.
If he was a major crier.. We would probably be both dead by now.
Anyways, he’s asleep again in the front sleep so I’ve left him alone. His head has gotten a lot better, and I’ve been making sure to change his bandages once in awhile.
So yeah, that’s happening right now. Hopefully we’ll get somewhat closer to the border before the car runs out of gas.
Dammit, alright, so we’re going to have to say a big hearty goodbye to this car for now. Why? Not because we ran out of fuel, no, but because I can’t go any further with it on the road.
Yep, that’s how bad the destruction is around here. Rubble and random objects have completely concealed the roads underneath, and it just looks like a really messed up rocky riverbank from afar.
Man, I really liked this car too. But I guess I was expecting this to happen sooner or later.

Making sure I grabbed everything… Yep, everything is here. Looks like Tobias wants to walk for now, so I guess we’ll see how far we can get. I’ve been hearing helicopters flying nearby, so we’ll need to be really careful.
I’ve done a lot of crazy stuff in my life, but I can’t say that I’ve ever had the pleasure of sleeping under a car for a night. Well, looks like tonight’s my chance to try it out!

Even though Tobi and I could keep on walking, it started to get dark so I decided it would be smart to find a place to stay for the night. Problem was, we were on a large highway with no real buildings nearby.
So it was decided. We were sleeping under a car. Another dark green car, just because it looked the most stable.
I really hope the US Government doesn’t decide to attack this area tonight. I don’t know where we would go if bombs started showering down on us like we were may flowers.
“Goodnight buddy, sweet dreams.”
So uh, something unexpected happened. Something that.. resulted in me currently driving a car towards the border of the city.
Yeah, okay, I hate it when I forget to turn the recorder on because I now have to recount all the past events that happened, and.. It’s a just pain to do so.

But to quickly summarize, after realizing the distance we have to cover to reach the western border of Greenville, I kinda panicked. We had no real food and water left to support us, and I knew my body would give out sooner or later.
So then I started searching for an alternative, something like a bicycle or even an abandoned grocery cart that would help relieve some of the load I had to carry.
But that was when I found our pot of gold, parked perfectly against the curb of a nearby street.
Even with its surroundings half-collapsed and torn down, this dark green car was almost in an impeccable condition, with only a few bumps and scratches here and there.

Okay, obviously it’s not as simple as that. It’s been almost a year since I’ve last driven, and also most of the roads are covered with random pieces of rubble, so.. let’s just say it’s taken a lot of patience and concentration to get this far.

But it’s worth it. We’ve gotten so much farther than we would have on foot, and all I have to keep an eye on is the ground and the sky. Wouldn’t want to be stuck in a car during an air-raid.. And oh yeah, landmines. I need to watch out for tho-

dict.string: New Mortar, Artillery, and Rocket Attacks

array.string: Owwwwww.
Totally forgot I was sleeping under a car for a second. Man.. that’s going to be a really nice bruise later.
But really, who would’ve thought sleeping on torn asphalt would be so comforting for your back?
It’s no tempur pedic mattress but hey, it worked. Other than the two times the ground shook from the commotion in the deeper parts of the city, I think I was actually able to get a few hours in.

Tobi’s already out from under the car and exploring the surrounding area. I should probably start getting ready too. Haven’t changed my clothes in what feels like decades though, so maybe I’ll take some time to clean up a bit.

And then off we’ll go, back on the road again. Honestly if the road starts to clear up a bit, I think I’m going to try to find and jump start another car. It made things easier last time, so maybe we’ll be lucky again.

Tobias chose the car this time. It’s a red Honda with a pretty nice interior, and I praised him for his good taste in cars. I mean, out of all the cars that were available, he really did pick the nicest one.
Not that it matters, though.
We’ve been on the road for a while now, and other than a few gunshots here in there the city has been really quiet today.
I hate the quiet. It’s always the noise I hear before something bad happens.
The routes we’ve been taking for the past thirty minutes have been really random, and is just mainly focused on a general direction.
I tried using proper pre-planned routes that I knew of before, but with several of them impassable, I just gave up. I’m pretty confident that we’ll get there someway or anoth-
“Oh, wait. Tobias, put your seatbelt on bud. I’m pretty sure we won’t get into an accident, but just in case. I don’t want you to get hurt.”
Ha, I’m a horrible guardian. I can’t even set a good example by wearing mine since it’s jammed for some reason.
Just.. how long is it going to take to get out of this godforsaken city? It’s probably only been about an hour or so of slow driving but.. I feel like we’ve been on the road for a day already.
Man, I hope we’ll reach the border by this afternoon.
Annnd I’m officially lost. Thought I knew what I was doing but.. Nope.
Oh, and not only am I lost, but I’m also partially trapped. Kinda.

The main roads we were driving on started to get more and more chaotic and cluttered, and I also thought I saw a group of possible LOTUS militants, so I quickly swerved and tried a more discreet road.

Well, little did I know, the discreet roads were a million times harder to maneuver through. And after around twenty minutes of barely hitting cars, we’re finally at a dead end, thanks to the never-ending sea of rubble. Damn.
“What do you say Tobi? Wanna take a quick break?”
Looks like it’s time for a lunch break. Hopefully I’ll figure out a way to get out of this mess by the time we go back on the road.
I’ve been thinking.
I’ve been thinking really hard.
And I’ve decided.
Once we get out of this hellhole, I’m gonna try to adopt Tobias.
Yeah, I’m young. Yeah, I’ve only know him for several days. But.. I don’t know. We’ve bonded so much in such a short period, and I can’t even imagine him not being a part of my life anymore.
I’d rather take care of him as my family, than have him taken away and sent to an orphanage in this war-torn country.
He needs me. And I need him. And so that’s how it’s going to be.
But first we need to make it out of this place alive. And to do that, I need to figure out where the hell we are.
A quick three-point turn, annd we’re back on track.
“Hmm? What was that? Are we there yet? Haha, nah buddy, not quite.”
“But we’re close, we’re reall-”
“You hear that Tobi? It’s a buzzing sound.. Almost like a bee-”
No. It’s getting louder.
Nonononononono. No. NO.
The sound. The way it vibrates right through your soul.
Bomber jets.
They’re here.
What do I do? Jump out of the car? Is there enough time? How will I get Tobias out? Can I drive away?
What do I do what do I do what do I do what do I-
I can’t even turn aroun- Oh shit, it’s too late, I see the plane. Did it see us move? Or did we stop just in time?
We’re a bright red target in a city full of rubble. Why the f*** did I agree on this red car? I should’ve thought it through. I shoul-
No, this is it. The final moment. They saw us, they’re coming, they’re dropping something, they’re-
Tobias.
He seems oblivious.
I need to get him out. I need to protect him somehow. I don’t care about me- I just-
“Hey Tobi, hey look at me bud- I need to get you out, we need to- NO-”
He’s still got his seatbelt on.
“..elp.. Hel… Help..”
Red.. That’s all.. I can see..
Am I.. am I in hell?
What’s- What’s going on?
Ow, f***, my head- I can’t- I can’t see-
Wait.. what’s this? This red.. Oh, oh shit, that’s a lot of blood. It’s mine, right?
What happe- I need to get ou-
